com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dto

Class AccessPermissionDto

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dto.AccessPermissionDto
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseDto, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReadOnlyAccessPermissionDto

    public class AccessPermissionDto
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable, BaseDto
    An access permission, that is either granted to a RoleDto or a member field, which indirectly grants this access permission to all users and/or roles named in that member field.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getMask

        public java.lang.Integer getMask()
        Get the mask of significant bits in the access permission mask (in case this access permissions is an override/delta of inherited permissions),
        Returns:
        the mask of significant/delta/override bits, or null, in case all bits in the (full) access permission mask are relevant
        Since:
        CB-7.2

      • setMask

        public void setMask(java.lang.Integer bits)
        Set the mask of significant/delta/override bits in the access permission mask (in case this access permissions is an override/delta of inherited permissions),
        Parameters:
        bits - is the mask of significant/delta/override bits, or null, if all bits in the (full) access permission mask are relevant
        Since:
        CB-7.2

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        An access permission equals another access permission if it is granted to the same role or field. The actual access permissions are not compared.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - should be another access permission
        Returns:
        true if obj is an access permission for the same role or field

      • createLookupMap

        public static java.util.SortedMap<AccessPermissionDto,AccessPermissionDto> createLookupMap(java.util.Collection<? extends AccessPermissionDto> permissions)
        Create a sorted lookup Map of the specified access permissions. Empty and duplicate permissions (same role/field) will not be contained in the result.
        Parameters:
        permissions - is a collection of access permissions
        Returns:
        a sorted lookup Map of the specified access permissions.
        Since:
        CB-7.3

      • equalSets

        public static boolean equalSets(java.util.Collection<? extends AccessPermissionDto> perms1,
                java.util.Collection<? extends AccessPermissionDto> perms2)
        Check if the two collections of access permissions represent equal sets of access permissions (empty items are ignored, duplicate items are only counted once)
        Parameters:
        perms1 - is the first collection of access permissions
        perms2 - is the second collection of access permissions
        Returns:
        true if both collections represent equal sets of access permissions, otherwise false
        Since:
        CB-7.3
